content:
A tip I give out pretty often to make your Zulip be a lot more responsive - put in gibberish into the USERS field top-right to remove the list of visible users:

Selection_158.png

That's an awesome tip!
This would be a great feature request for the Zulip core - only show online people unless searching, that would make the list FAR shorter, and likely have the same performance improvement?
That's a good idea. I've added it.

On a somewhat related note, I've been having two issues with the Windows desktop app: (1) the compose box is about 1/4 of the width of the message column (for example, this message wordwraps just after "I've" at the start of the paragraph), (2) I cannot change any settings (subscribed streams, etc.) from the app, either from the settings icon at the top right, or the icon in the stream list.

I was seeing this before and after the recent server upgrade.

Has anyone else seen this?
Are you running the latest Electron app from https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/releases @Elliot Silver ?
No, I'm running the other desktop app, version 0.5.1 I think. I tried the electron one at one point and reverted back to the other app for some reason, but I don't recall why.
OK -- I think the old app is unsupported and the recommendation is to upgrade.
If there are broken things about it, would be good to report (either at https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/issues or here)
OK, I'll try switching to electron again and see if it works better, and if I can recall the issue.
So, now that I've installed the electron app, I remember the issue -- the task bar icon doesn't show the unread count.
Ah! Thanks for finding and commenting on https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/issues/167
Yay! Zulip fixed the unread count badge issue. Now we just need them to build a client.
As in issue a release? Indeed. (If you want to play, you can also build with npm â€” https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/blob/master/development.md)
Yes, I could -- or I could actually get some work done today.
